sense.gloss: to become sober, to sober up, to regain consciousness (e.g. after anaesthesia)
to come to one's senses, to be disillusioned
to awaken to (instinct, ability, perception, etc.), to become aware of, to become conscious of, to realize
to awaken, to arouse from sleep
to bring to one's senses, to disabuse (someone of)
to dampen, to throw a damper on, to spoil
stimulant (e.g. psychoactive drugs like methamphetamine, ritalin, etc.)
spoiled fun, loss of interest, damper (e.g. on the party), wet blanket, turn-off
remarkable, striking, brilliant, splendid, spectacular, wonderful, conspicuous, outstanding, amazing
to lose interest, to be dampened (of enjoyment, interest, etc.), to fall flat, to turn sour

sdata.j: ↑初↑↓はじ↓めて↑催眠↑↓さいみん↓に↑入↑↓はい↓る↑人↑↓ひと↓の↑場合↑↓ばあい↓、とても↑浅↑↓あさ↓い↑催眠↑↓さいみん↓↑状態↑↓じょうたい↓から、↑覚醒↑↓かくせい↓してもらって、↑催眠↑↓さいみん↓↑状態↑↓じょうたい↓と↑普通↑↓ふつう↓に↑覚醒↑↓かくせい↓した↑状態↑↓じょうたい↓とを↑比↑↓くら↓べてもらうことがよくあります。
sdata.e: When people are being put into a hypnotic state for the first time I often, after placing them in a very light hypnotic state, wake them and ask them to compare their wakening state to that when hypnotised.

sdata.j: おそらく↑自分↑↓じぶん↓には↑半↑↓はん↓↑覚醒↑↓かくせい↓の↑時間↑↓じかん↓があり、そのため１↑日↑↓にち↓を↑短↑↓みじか↓く↑感↑↓かん↓じている。
sdata.e: It's quite possible that there are times I am half awake, and thus the day feels shorter.
